item.title: ARIM deployment
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: ARIM(emPOWER) Deployment (updated)

Revision History:
    2016-07-11 11:31:08 - Version 1 created by Bao
    2016-10-18 0 8:56:31 - added tag update

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites:
- CTAC VPN
- RDP application installed
- Credentials to connect

Related URLs:
- Application URL: http://www.phe.gov/empowermap/Pages/default.aspx

Servers:
- ec2-54-161-23-76.compute-1.amazonaws.com
- ec2-54-205-73-86.compute-1.amazonaws.com

Overview:
- stop meteor application
- delete nationalCmsData.json
- start meteor application
- invalidate cache in AWS



Steps to deploy:
1) RDP into ARIM application server 1
2) Stop the application
Using one of the open shell windows that are running meteor: CTRL+C, and CTRL+C again to stop
3) Using Windows Explorer, delete the following file:
C:/arim_static_site/public/nationalCmsData.json
4) Start meteor again:
Using the shell window from Step 2, run the following:
meteor —-production
5) Repeat steps 1-4 for ARIM application server 2
6) Invalidate cache
- log into ARIM AWS (see 1password for credentials)
- Go to Services > Storage & Content Delivery > Cloudfront
- Click the only distribution found on this page for ARIM (The ID is E1279ZBFKQ7SBK)
- Select the Invalidations tab
- Select checkbox for the latest Invalidation
- Click Copy. This will take approx 30 minutes. In the meantime, you can ask Dan to validate by going directly to the Windows servers’ public DNS. He’ll probably prefer to test using the URL, though.

Steps to update  the tag:
1) If not already done so, RDP into ARIM application server 1
2) Ensure meteor is not running
3) go to C:/
4) Backup C:/arim_static_site
5) While still in the RDP, log into bitbucket and go to the empower_map repo > Downloads > Tags
6) Select the zip file for the appropriate tag
7) Unzip and move the contents of the zip file into C:/arim_static_site
8) While you’re here it might be a good idea to confirm that C:/arim_static_site/public/nationalCmsData.json does not exist
9) Start meteor.
 


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: ARIM ruby on rails deployment
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: ARIM(emPOWER) Deployment (updated)

Revision History:
    2017-04-20 09:24:08 - Version 1 created by Bao


Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites:
- CTAC VPN
- RDP application installed
- Credentials to connect (1password)

Related URLs:
- Application URL: https://empowermap.hhs.gov
- Stage application URL: https://stage-empowermap.hhs.gov

Servers:
- hhs-arim-01
- hhs-arim-02

Overview:
The application has been converted to Ruby on Rails on Windows
- Stop the Rails process
- git pull
- start the rails process
- invalidate cache

Steps to deploy:
1) RDP into ARIM application server 1
2) Stop the application
Using one of the open shell windows that are running meteor: CTRL+C, and CTRL+C again to stop
and answer ‘Y’ to the prompt if applicable

Run the bundle command:
bundle exec rake import_dme_data RAILS_ENV=production

3) - Starting the Rails application. In a powershell window:
   cd c:/empower_map
   bundle exec puma -e production -p 3000

   or in 1 swoop:
   cd 'c:/empower_map'; bundle exec puma -e production -p 3000

NOTE: anytime there is a change to JS or CSS, you will need to run:  bundle exec rake assets:precompile   before starting it up.

4) Invalidate cache
- log into ARIM AWS (see 1password for credentials)
- Go to Services > Storage & Content Delivery > Cloudfront
- Click the only distribution found on this page for ARIM (The ID is E1279ZBFKQ7SBK)
- Select the Invalidations tab
- Select checkbox for the latest Invalidation
- Click Copy. This will take approx 30 minutes. In the meantime, you can ask Dan to validate by going directly to the Windows servers’ public DNS. He’ll probably prefer to test using the URL, though.




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.
